p: The UHPLC-MS/MS analysis revealed that Protea caffra contained varying quantities of both hydroxybenzoic and hydroxycinnamic acids ( Table 4 and Table 5). Overall, the most abundant hydroxybenzoic ( p-hydroxybenzoic acid, 374.55 µg/g DW) and hydroxycinnamic (caffeic acid, 266.37 µg/g DW) acids were detected in the leaves. The leaves also contained the least abundant hydroxycinnamic acids (sinapic acid, 0.08 µg/g DW), while the bark contained the least abundant hydroxybenzoic acid (salicylic acid, 0.1 µg/g DW).
